item.title: Sunrise Lamp
item.author: 2e0byo@gmail.com (John Morris)
item.description: Every project is a prototype, which calls out for a second version avoiding the mistakes of the former. The trick is to give the prototypes away; then one has a legitimate excuse to make another—and one gains an (undeserved) reputation for generosity to boot. After the quick sunrise alarm clock various things happened, including a ’two week lockdown’ to build up capacity in the NHS, which turned into three months. Thus I was stuck in one part of London, and my fiancée in another, and the streets were patrolled by Dobermans with £10,000 fine notices stuck to their teeth.
